revised_title: Interference Microscopy for Analyzing Mitosis in Single Living Cells
tldr: The authors developed a new method of using interference microscopy to analyze changes in dry mass and concentration during the growth of a single tissue cell. They applied this method to study mitosis in endosperm cells, observing changes in dry mass and concentration in various cell components. This technique allowed for a better understanding of the processes involved in cell division.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
